text: Facade of the madrasa Madrasa Saheb Ettabaâ () is one of the madrasahs of the medina of Tunis. == Localization == It is located in Sidi El Aloui Street, near Saheb Ettabaâ Mosque in El Halfaouine square. == History== The madrasa was built with the Saheb Ettabaâ Mosque during the Husainid era following the orders of Youssef Saheb Ettabaâ. In 1930, it accommodated 71 students. After the independence, a part of the madrasa became the office of a Neo Destour club. == Description== It is divided into two parts: The main one is called Madrasa Saheb Ettabaâ Al Kubra (big madrasa) while the other one is named Madrasa Saheb Ettabaâ Al Sughra (small madrasa). == Teachers== Sidi Brahim Riahi was one the most popular professors to teach in this madrasa like Mohamed Laroussi Metoui. The last director of the madrasa was Omar Chachia. == References == Saheb Ettabaâ
title: Madrasa Saheb Ettabaâ
